intro: Ouratea saldariagae, commonly known as the Saldariga Ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface, while its fruit is a small, fleshy capsule. This species is often found in shaded, humid environments and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its habitat.
